etymology.description: 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") + 睪(睪) (yì, "testes") as phonetic component -> indicates action related to sorting or selecting with the hand -> 擇(擇) (zé, "to pick")
etymology.interpretation: The character 擇(擇) (zé, "to pick") combines the semantic element 手(手) (shǒu, "hand"), symbolizing manual action, with a phonetic element 睪(睪) (yì), which provides a sound clue. This fusion suggests the act of picking or selecting, performed manually.
etymology.simplification: 择(擇): 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") and 睪(睪) (yì, "testes") were simplified to retain the phonetic and semantic hint while reducing the strokes.

examples.chinese: 他在众多方案中擇了一個最佳方案(他在眾多方案中擇了一個最佳方案)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài zhòngduō fāng'àn zhōng zé le yī gè zuìjiā fāng'àn.
examples.english: He picked the best plan among many options.

examples.chinese: 我们應該擇明智的老師(我们應該擇明智的老師)，因為知識可以改變命運(因為知識可以改變命運)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yīnggāi zé míngzhì de lǎoshī, yīnwèi zhīshi kěyǐ gǎibiàn mìngyùn.
examples.english: We should choose a wise teacher because knowledge can change destiny.

examples.chinese: 你應該擇合適的時機(你應該擇合適的時機)，去追求夢想(去追求夢想)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yīnggāi zé héshì de shíjī, qù zhuīqiú mèngxiǎng.
examples.english: You should pick the right moment to pursue your dreams.
